abstract: Apple is seeking new deals from the music labels to add ringtones and other offerings to the iPhone. The negotiations are active now because Apple appears to want to introduce new features in June.
snippet: Apple is seeking new deals from the music labels to add ringtones and other offerings to the iPhone. The negotiations are active now because Apple appears to want to introduce new features in June.
lead_paragraph: As part of Apple’s efforts to improve on the shortcomings of its popular iPhone, the company has approached some of the major music labels to try to expand the variety of ringtones and other musical features available on the device, several label executives said last week. The negotiations are very active right now and a final deal has not been set, said the executives, who requested anonymity so as not to disrupt the ongoing talks.

headline.main: Apple Wants More Mobile Music From Labels

abstract: Apple ended its Mac clone program in 1998, soon after Steve Jobs rejoined the company. At the time, there was little reason to suspect that it would ever be revived. Now a Mac clone is back, but this time without Apple’s blessings.
snippet: Apple ended its Mac clone program in 1998, soon after Steve Jobs rejoined the company. At the time, there was little reason to suspect that it would ever be revived. Now a Mac clone is back, but this time without Apple’s blessings.
lead_paragraph: Apple ended its Mac clone program in 1998, soon after Steven P. Jobs rejoined the company. At the time, there was little reason to suspect that it would ever be revived. Now a Mac clone is back, but this time without Apple’s blessing.
